author: Staff Reporter
text:
Board acts on complaints from farmers

The Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board (TNPCB), Vaniyambadi has asked 120 member units of VANITEC Limited’s Common Effluent Treatment Plant (CETP) in Vaniyambadi to suspend the wet process operations following complaints from farmers.

M. Malaiyandi, district environmental engineer of TNPCB, Vaniyambadi had received a complaint from farmers of Girisamudram on Wednesday morning that CETP was discharging effluents into an irrigation canal. The official immediately rushed to the spot. “There was no discharge into the canal at the time of inspection, but we found a flexible hose pipe from the CETP in the canal,” Mr. Malaiyandi said.

Zero liquid discharge system

The pipe was from the last component of the CETP – solar evaporation pan, he said, adding that there are 120 member units linked to the CETP. CETPs have to follow zero liquid discharge system, he noted.

“Following this, we have given instructions orally to the 120 member units to temporarily stop wet process activities.

These are operations in which effluents are generated until further instructions from TNPCB, Chennai. This is because the member units should not send out the water to the CETP,” he said.

The official has sent a report to the board’s chairperson in Chennai for further decision.
title: TNPCB asks member-units to suspend wet operations
